definitions.definition: to burn brightly either for a short time or not regularly:
examples: The flame above the oil well flared (up) into the dark sky.

definitions.definition: a sudden increase in the brightness of a fire:
examples: There was a sudden flare when she threw the petrol onto the fire.

definitions.definition: a very bright light or coloured smoke that can be used as a signal, or a device that produces this:
examples: We set off a flare to help guide our rescuers.
